DOC.brief_title: Effect Glycemic Index Diet Metabolic Reproductive Parameters Overweight Obese Infertile Women
DOC.detailed_description: Infertility currently recognize disorder relate obesity . Among several metabolic change associate obesity , insulin resistance appear link hormonal disorder affect reproductive system . Leptin ghrelin hormone involve energy balance regulation also associate reproductive system regulation , relationship infertility scarce . The aim study determine effect hypocaloric diet different glycemic index ghrelin leptin level , hormonal , metabolic reproductive parameter infertile overweight obese woman candidate vitro fertilization . Infertile woman grade I II obesity , pre-obesity increase waist circumference recruit . Patients assign Hypocaloric Low Glycemic Index diet group ; Hypocaloric Conventional diet group Control group ( maintenance usual diet ) , follow protocol 12 week . The two intervention diet similar term caloric intake macronutrient distribution different term carbohydrate quality ( index glycemic load ) . Immediately end diet protocol , patient submit vitro fertilization treatment . Before intervention anthropometric measurement ( weight , height , body mass index , waist hip circumference ) body composition ( body fat percentage determine measurement seven skinfolds ) evaluate well biochemical parameter : leptin , acylated ghrelin , glucose , insulin , serum lipid ( total cholesterol lipoprotein , triglyceride ) , sex hormone - follicle stimulate hormone ( FSH ) , luteinizing hormone ( LH ) , estradiol , progesterone , prolactin , testosterone sex hormone bind globulin ( SHBG ) . Primary outcome : clinical pregnancy rate . Secondary outcome : HOMA-IR ( Homeostasis Model Assessment ) , acylated ghrelin leptin level , body fat percentage , number oocyte retrieve , percentage fertilize oocyte embryo quality .
DOC.criteria: Diagnose female infertility indication treatment vitro fertilization Body Mass Index ( BMI ) equal great 30 kg/m² BMI > 25 kg/m² increase waist circumference ( > 80 cm ) ; Being treat ( diet ) weight loss/gain maintain stable body weight three month prior study ; Not stomach/digestive problem Not knowledge cardiovascular disease history ; Nonsmokers ; Not use medication . Patients BMI equal high 40 kg/m² ( morbid obesity ) Patients already receive type nutritional intervention Patients comorbidities may interfere reproductive capacity ( genetic and/or endocrine disorder , diabetes mellitus , cancer , liver kidney failure ) , alcoholic , individual contact ( work ) heavy metal chemical ( exposure solvent pesticide ) Lack adherence propose dietary treatment
